intro: Fimbriella peramoena, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and its showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Fimbriella peramoena is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
